title: E.F. Seedling Amaryllus 1819
marks:
Title; Date; Inscription

in pencil, LL recto: [
text: As a child, Priscilla Bury began to draw and paint flowers as a ladylike diversion. Trained as neither a botanist nor a professional artist, she still managed to rival the greatest botanical illustrators of all time.
creditline:
The Minnich Collection
The Ethel Morrison Van Derlip Fund
